CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;Erik Møse;Julia Laffranque;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) found that unlawful actions of police officers in DATE had resulted in harm to the applicant ’s health manifesting itself in partial loss of ability to work . This judgment and a supplementary judgment of CARDINAL DATE recovered from the ORG treasury in the applicant ’s favour lost earnings up to DATE in the amount of MONEY ( RUB ) and compensation of non - pecuniary damage in the amount of RUB CARDINAL . It appears from the applicant ’s own submissions that the award was paid to him in DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant brought a new action seeking recovery of lost earnings for the period from DATE to DATE and further DATE payments to be re - calculated in accordance with the minimum wage , reimbursement of expert fees and compensation for sanatorium treatment .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG granted his claims in part , however the judgment was reversed on appeal on DATE , and the case was remitted to the first instance for fresh examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again granted the claims in part awarding the applicant lost earnings in the amount of RUB CARDINAL and related DATE payments in the amount of RUB CARDINAL,CARDINAL to be adjusted to the cost of living , RUB CARDINAL for sanatorium treatment , and RUB CARDINAL as reimbursement of the expert fees .

CARDINAL . The above judgment was not challenged on appeal . The enforcement documents received by ORG on DATE were returned to the applicant in DATE due to unidentified inconsistencies in the judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG considered the applicant ’s application for adjustment of the amounts awarded by the judgment of DATE . The court rejected the application but clarified the original judgment by specifying that the responsibility for its enforcement lay with ORG . A new writ of enforcement was issued .

CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment of DATE was enforced in full . It transpires from the documents submitted by the Government and covering the period DATE and DATE that the DATE payments in the amount determined by ORG on DATE were regularly credited to the applicant ’s account .
